title: Mukesh Khanna Makes Controversial Comment On Ranbir Kapoor Playing Lord Ram: 'If You're A Chhichhora...' - News18
summary:
Mukesh Khanna Criticizes Ranbir Kapoor's Casting as Lord Ram

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: News18

Mukesh Khanna has raised eyebrows with his remarks concerning Ranbir Kapoor, who has been cast as Lord Ram in the upcoming film Ramayana. Khanna expressed concern that Kapoor's previous roles could affect how audiences perceive his portrayal of such a revered character.

  • Khanna hesitated to comment, fearing backlash, but affirmed that comparisons with Arun Govil are inevitable.
  • He stated that whoever plays Ram must embody the character in their real life as well.
  • Khanna highlighted that the public reception of actors like Prabhas should inform casting choices.
  • Ranbir Kapoor's role is significant for the Kapoor family, and he hopes Kapoor's recent negative portrayal in Animal won't overshadow his performance as Ram.
  • Details about other cast members include Sai Pallavi as Sita and potential casting for Hanuman.
“If you’re playing Ram, you’re not allowed to party and drink. But who am I to decide who plays Ram?” - Mukesh Khanna

The film is set to release in two parts, with the first part launching on Diwali 2026 and the second on Diwali 2027.
newTitle: Mukesh Khanna Criticizes Ranbir Kapoor's Casting as Lord Ram

title: EXCLUSIVE: Anil Thadanis Pushpa 2 locks horns with Baby John over screens; leaves exhibitors in a bind with advance booking halted - Bollywood Hungama
summary:
EXCLUSIVE: Anil Thadani’s Pushpa 2 locks horns with Baby John over screens; leaves exhibitors in a bind with advance booking halted

Publication Date: December 2023 Source: Bollywood Hungama

Pushpa 2 – The Rule continues to perform strongly but has faced issues with advance bookings due to a conflict between its distributor and that of Baby John, which releases on December 25.

  • Advance bookings for Pushpa 2 have been halted in many theaters for the coming weekend.
  • Anil Thadani, distributor of Pushpa 2, has mandated equal showings with Baby John for the holiday period.
  • The conflict is described as a tactical move by Thadani against PVR Inox Pictures, distributor of Baby John.
  • Theatres are waiting for a resolution to start bookings for Pushpa 2 while limited bookings have begun in some cinemas.
“If they don’t accept Thadani ji’s demands, theatres will not be able to play Pushpa 2 over this weekend.”

The ongoing conflict highlights the competitive nature of film releases during the holiday season, and both sides are working towards a compromise.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Faces Screening Battles with Baby John

summary:
John Cena vs Roman Reigns: Which WWE superstar has higher net worth

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: India.com

There’s an enduring debate among WWE fans, and it's all about deciding who is truly the greatest of all time. The argument frequently swings between John Cena and Roman Reigns, reflecting their dominance in the wrestling world.

  • John Cena has a net worth of approximately $80 million, primarily due to his career as a 16-time World Champion in WWE.
  • Roman Reigns has a net worth of $14 million and earns an estimated $5 million per year from WWE.
  • John Cena's WWE salary is reported to be around $10 million per year.
  • The financial comparison favors John Cena, highlighting his significant economic success in the wrestling industry.
"If we compare their financial status, it's clear that John Cena's economic success is tremendous, boasting an impressive net worth of $80 million. This notably overshadows Roman Reigns, whose net worth amounts to $14 million."

In conclusion, while both superstars have achieved remarkable careers in WWE, John Cena's financial achievements place him significantly ahead of Roman Reigns.
newTitle: John Cena vs Roman Reigns: Comparing Their Net Worth

title: Rifle Club Review | A Mild Wild West Set In the Western Ghats - Lensmen Reviews
summary:
Rifle Club Review | A Mild Wild West Set In the Western Ghats

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Lensmen Reviews

The movie Rifle Club creatively merges the Wild West theme with the scenic backdrop of Kerala's hill stations. It follows a Malayalam superstar's training day at a rifle club in 1991, culminating in an engaging face-off between rival gangs.

  • The film's runtime is approximately 114 minutes.
  • A focus on character development and the club's dynamics.
  • The screenplay draws parallels between the narrative and hunting.
  • Strong performances by Dileesh Pothan (Avaran) and Anurag Kashyap (as the antagonist).
  • Vibrant cinematography and a notable musical score enhance the film’s ambiance.
“While the pre-climax face-off between the two gangs is pretty slick and engaging, somewhere, I felt the finale needed a bit more refinement to have that wow factor.”

The film offers a blend of humor and intensity, though it concludes with a slightly underwhelming finale. However, it reassures viewers that Aashiq Abu's creative prowess remains intact.

title: Laapataa Ladies' Oscars drama explained: How India selects 'official' entry, what is Film Federation of India's role - Hindustan Times
summary:
Laapataa Ladies' Oscars Drama Explained: How India Selects Official Entry

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

As Laapataa Ladies crashes out of the Oscars race, this article explores the selection process for India's 'official' entry to the Academy Awards, shedding light on the role of the Film Federation of India.

  • This year marks the 23rd consecutive year that India will not have a film in the Oscars' Best International Feature Film category.
  • The Film Federation of India (FFI) is responsible for selecting India's official entry for the Oscars.
  • Laapataa Ladies was chosen from nearly 30 contenders, including notable films like Animal and All We Imagine as Light.
  • Only one film can be submitted as an 'official' entry, but filmmakers can still submit titles independently for other categories.
  • Historically, three Indian films have been nominated for the Oscars: Mother India, Salaam Bombay, and Lagaan.
“It has never been without drama.”

The ongoing struggles in selecting a film for international representation highlight the challenges faced by Indian cinema on the global stage.
newTitle: Laapataa Ladies' Oscars Drama Explained: India's Official Selection Process
